column4: is there a tool to see the degree of file fragmentation on an ext3 filesystem?

fsck prints non-contiguous, not fragmentation.  also, that percentage happens to be growing for me on my home partition.  How would I know if fragmentation is not occurring if there are no tests for it?
like for instance, I have 11% non-contiguous for filesystem, which begs to question, what percentage (if any) is fragmented?
fragmentation does not have a major performance impact on linux filesystems
